Review Text: Thank you Kevin for turning me o to SettleUp!  I used to be a shut in, afraid to accept invitations to go out with friends‚Ä¶ the stress of putting down multiple credit cards , or the annoyance of getting a friend‚Äôs pocket change to pay ‚Äútheir share‚Äù.  I‚Äôm social again thanks to you Kevin‚Ä¶ and SettleUp!

This is absolutely one of the best if not the best splitting app available. 

First- the most common activity on this kind of app is adding an expense on the go, so you want it to be quick and painless. Settle up by far has the fastest expense adding framework, because you can start by tapping the name of the person who paid. Seems like a small thing, but it makes a big difference in the field. 

Second- exporting transactions is not behind a paywall. 

Third- unlimited transactions not behind paywall. 

Fourth- default shares for groups and an advanced expense adding experience for things like meals where tax and tip might be separate from the item subtotal. This includes a calculator in the subtotal area as well. 

Overall- the app looks a little dated. But who cares. All the basic functionality is there, it‚Äôs the fastest to add an expense, and only appropriate functionality is behind the paywall (like categories, receipt storage, and recurring transactions).

Review Title: Ui/UX issues and sometimes things don‚Äôt work with no reason given
Review Text: Looks like classic ‚Äòengineer UI‚Äô. Pure chaos. Took forever to add people, no error messages given for why scanning code or accepting invites didn‚Äôt work just noticed happened. Once setup and ignoring UI issues it appeared to work but way too much effort for the category.

We have tried many other expense spitting tools, and this is by far the best for group houses!

- Categorizes for transactions
- Receipt uploads
- Allows for income splitting 
- Group Pro plan available

The user interface could use improvement to make it easy to navigate. For example it take multiple clicks and it‚Äôs also not intuitive how to ‚Äúsettle up‚Äù. The add are also way to invasive. Lastly it‚Äôs way too expensive for what it‚Äôs offering. 

On the plus side the development team is very responsive. I contacted them with an issue and they were very helpful and quick.

I tried the free version of this app on a trip with three other people, and the app doesn‚Äôt even give you individualized debts.

I ended up having to take all the expenses out of the app and put them in a spreadsheet to figure out who really owed whom.

Review Title: Takes all the stress out of group outings
Review Text: This app was a game changer on a recent group trip. It allowed us to relax and just live our best lives while not having to worry about whether we were kicking in too much or not enough, or having to do any kind of math with vacation brains. Can't recommend it enough.

Worked great until it didn‚Äôt. With the free version, I was able to add and settle debts, just had to watch a few ads. 

Suddenly, I go to add some debts and it is giving me only a net summary of ALL debts, including those already settled. So it is now essentially useless bc there‚Äôs no way to tell what we actually have paid each other. 

Bummer bc I liked this a lot for settling roommate bills.

Review Title: Great app, very intuitive and well thought through. But
Review Text:
This is the best app for splitting expenses I found. It has a very slick interface, all required details are easily available and accessible. 

I wish it had 3 relatively small features that I proposed to the authors that could be implemented (had no negative or positive response from the authors so far).

Ability to assign a fixed amount to a person(s) and exclude them from further sharing. Use case: a participant bought something completely different and their prices are fixed regarding the rest of the spending
Ability to assign adjustments for sharing. Use case: in a restaurant, the entire bill is split evenly but one person ordered an expensive drink for himself and wants to exclude this amount from sharing, or a person didn‚Äôt order an expensive dessert and its share should be reduced by this amount
Ability to create a paying group which is very natural in multi-family events (especially with children who could be accounted for differently). All calculations are as is but in the end, group spending and debts are combined. It makes regular accounting simple. No multipliers, all other accounting as described in 1) and 2) are still applicable on the individual level but the final settlement is natural
The nice thing is that all these features could be introduced in a way that the old interface would work the same way without additional complexity for those who are not interested yet accommodating more complex use cases. 

I hope developers would listen to this proposals, it doesn‚Äôt look too complex and should not change the existing API too much
Perfect alternative! Would love to have a friend view along with the group view as i have same friends across a lot of groups

Used Splitwise for YEARS until they started prompting for payment and allowing only a set amount of daily entries, thought we‚Äôd give this one a shot. Was looking good until I realized within a week that this app was even worse‚Ä¶ playing those horrific ads you cant even skip. Deleting.

Review Title: Fantastic travel companion for group expenses
Review Text: I absolutely love this app. Been traveling with friends for years, and this one has been the absolute best. It allows weighted contributions for people‚Ä¶ for example, a married couple can have an assigned value of 2, and single people can have a value of 1. Making it so an even split bill (such as a taxi or hotel) will automatically split appropriately. If you‚Äôre traveling through multiple countries with multiple currencies, it will accurately convert the consolidated debts of each person in a group. We used to spend hours obsessing over who owes what at the end of a trip, but it‚Äôs not an issue anymore. It‚Äôs worth purchasing premium for the group (one time cost, benefits all transactions within the group). Groups can be reset after a trip is complete, which means you can continue having the perks of premium for a future trip at no extra cost.

came here from splitwise after splitwise chose to throw a paywall on basic functions, like more than a couple transactions a day. 

settle up has all the features of splitwise free + some extras, like adding expenses by bill and separating tip and tax. 

free users may occasionally see an ad. annoying, but better than a paywall.
I use this for all of my trips! It is so helpful. I used to struggle splitting costs with my friends before but now this app makes it so much easier. Definitely recommend!
App is working perfect. We use it for our trip without any problems. Can only recommend for others.

Review Title: One of the finest app of all time!
Review Text: I just want to say thanks to the developers. Great job!

I am obsessed with this app. It has great functionality and I love that you can send the info to people without them having to sign up or download the app. The different currencies feature is great too! I would recommend this for everyone.
This made our trip to the Bahamas with 6 people so simple! Love not having to figure out who owes what and who should pay next!

I can‚Äôt even login anymore.  Thanks for destroying what used to be a helpful app that I believe I bought years ago.  With the new version, I‚Äôm just moving on to something else.  Utterly ridiculous.  Just lost a loyal user.  Next time leave it alone and maybe your base would continue to use it.

Still : nope

for an app that actually costs money, this is horribly designed, completely unintuitive. for instance, when you click on a person‚Äôs name, you expect to see all the things he/she paid for, but no, it takes you to the ‚Äúadding a debt‚Äù menu, yet there‚Äôs a huge dedicated ‚Äú+‚Äù sign serving just that purpose. Also, there are no integration with payment apps like paypal or venmo, so when you click on ‚Äúsettle debt‚Äù there are no way of actually settling the debt. 

there are free apps that does exactly this with much more elegance, splitwise for instance. unless they revamp the UI, i don‚Äôt see any reason why anyone should pay for THIS.

An existing group can be unstable. Had several cases where one or two costs don't get shared across the group - meaning members all see different balances (all show as synced however). Review Title: Worse performance and usage than its predecessor
Review Text:
Hi Settle Up developers!

I recently installed the new version of Settle Up (by paying 2‚Ç¨ of course) and I was expecting big improvements but unfortunately this version let me down.

There are three main issues that I would like to highlight:

- Edit payments amounts it is not possible. The new amount will be added to the old one, instead of replacing it. Or if there is a way to do it, I don‚Äôt find it.
- Weight payments is very difficult to handle. You have to play with the values to match to the expenses of every single member of the group.

For example: There is a payment of 10‚Ç¨ common for 3 friends, but only two of them have paid: A pays 2‚Ç¨ and B pays 8‚Ç¨. I would expect that the App lets me introduce the quantities directly, otherwise I have to calculate the weights, which has no sense within an App that does everything automatically.

- Last but not least, it is the user experience. I think the App has not been tested in real scenarios. When there are more than 6-7 members you cannot insert the name and see the name at the same time while typing. It could be a rendering issue.

I find this App very practical and interesting and I hope all together we can improve its performance.

Many thanks in advance and I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
√Ålvaro

Review Title: Buona ma sarebbe perfetta con alcune modifiche
Review Text:

Review Title: Still has issues but a great app!
Review Text:
It always get hang when used with USB tethering turned on. One needs to take it back and forth from background to work. Gets hang every 5 seconds.

Other than this the app is great. Recent google login issues have been fixed . Great work by the developers.
